page.title: 02LAND USE AND VEGETATION.
page.content: ON THE LIMESTONE CLIFFS ARE GOOD SOILS AND THE FARMS ARE ENGAGED IN DAIRYING,LIVESTOCK AND MARKET GARDENING. TO THE EAST OF LLANRHIDIAN IS THE MILLSTONE GRIT SUMMIT OF CIL IFOR TOP.THIS IS THE REMAINS OF AN IRON AGE CAMP,THE LARGEST IN GOWER COVERING APPROXIMATELY EIGHT ACRES.FURTHER EAST IS THE OPEN MOORLAND OF WELSHMOOR MAINLY NATIONAL TRUST OWNED.THE FORESTRY COMMISSION HAVE ALSO PLANTED CONIFEROUS TREES IN THIS AREA. THE MARSH WHICH IS FOUND IN THE TOP HALF OF THE QUADRANT IS DRAINED BY THE BURRY ESTUARY.THE FLORA INCLUDES SEA ASTER,LAVENDER,MARSH MALLOW,RUSH,JUNCUS AND SPARTINA.THE MARSH IS TIDAL.ON THE SANDS TO THE NORTH COCKLES ARE FOUND ON WHICH THE PENCLAWDD INDUSTRY IS BASED.
